episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including Harry Houdini's escape artist dog, the employment of girl guides by MI5 during World War I, a fictional detective created as the opposite of Sherlock Holmes, and the unique Himalayan cheese used as chewing gum.

facts.fact: Harry Houdini's dog was a professional escape artist.
In the First World War, MI5 employed 90 girl guides. They tried Boy Scouts at first, but found they couldn't be trusted.

There is a fictional Victorian detective who was created to be the opposite of Sherlock Holmes. In the only recent adaptation of the stories, the detective in question was played by Benedict Cumberbatch.
Himalayan chewing gum is made out of cheese.
